item.description:
TAGIRON is a logical deduction game played with number tiles and question cards. You win if you can guess all of your opponent's tiles. Put on your thinking cap!

Place all of the number tiles face down and shuffle them. Place your game screen in front of you, then randomly take five tiles. Place them face up behind your screen in numerically ascending order starting from the left. If you have two tiles with the same number, place the red tile on the left. Once you have placed your tiles, removed the unused number tiles from the game. Lastly, shuffle the question cards and place them in a pile face down. Draw the top six cards from the pile and place them in the center of the table.

Deduce all of your opponent's tiles and correctly guess their colors and numbers in order from left to right.

Then, they roll the dice and try to avoid raiders while completing various sets, runs, or combinations depending on the action chosen. Complete every action at each location to find the ancient artifacts!

item.description:
The boardgame 66d6 is a two-player tactical game with simple rules and lots of dice. Easy to learn, hard to master.

Players both have an army of 33 minions (dice) at their disposal, to take to battle with the enemy forces.

Dice rolls determine composition of your army. How you use your army is up to the player. There are no bad rolls; merely changing tactics.

item.description:
ADAMASTOR is a Whimsical Competitive Boardgame of horrible sea monsters that live in the depths of the sea, where the Atlantic meets the Indian Ocean, fighting amongst each other to be the one that gets to skink the very unfortunate ships that atempt to cross the Cape of Torments.

---

The game of ADAMASTOR is played with 2 to 4 players. Each game lasts 5 rounds (6 with 2 players), at the end of which the
player with the most total of Victory points (VP) is the winner of the game.

Each player controls one sea monster. Players use simultaneous card play to move their monsters on the
board and attack ships and other player’s monsters. The cards chosen cards also determine the turn order (the better the actions, the slower you are). Players score victory points either by sinking the Portuguese
fleet or by knocking down other sea Monsters or by completing variable objectives that make each game feel different. At the end of each round players will each choose and gain a new action card that provides them with better Monster Actions for the following rounds.

---

Adamastor is a card-driven simultaneous action selection game with fast paced mechanic and a modular board that keeps every game fun and fresh.

The water is dirty in the center of the lake complex. So, the fishes must find their way to the other lakes in the extremities of the lake complex. There, they will have pure water and a peaceful time.

Each player controls a quantity of fishes. He must change the spaces on the board to create a way straight to a clean lake. As more tiles the way have, as more it changes the lake itself.

Description from the publisher:

Shit For Brains was borne out of a love for bar trivia and a hate for boring facts. Frustrated with questions about Presidents (but not about naked Presidents), and rivers (but not about rivers catching on fire), and animals (but not about weirdly-shaped animal penises), we decided to make a game for people like us. It's a game full of hilarious, morbid, irreverent, outrageous, disgusting, ironic, awesome, pathetic, twisted, and downright weird trivia. Each SFB box comes with 600 cards (6 categories with 100 cards each), a timer, die, and a whole lot of love and bad jokes.

The gameplay is incredibly simple- a team/player rolls the die, and then is asked a question from the corresponding deck. If they answer correctly, they keep the card and roll again. If they get it wrong, it's the next person/team's turn. First team to get one card in each category is the winner! Easy, right?

The starter set comes with the following categories:


 Bodily Functions 
 Crime & Death 
 Drugs, Man 
 'Merica 
 Nature Calls 
 Sexy Time

KhromaZones is a quick, family-friendly game that plays competitively, cooperatively or solo, where you use colorful gemstone cards to claim zones and score points.

Each player uses their hand of colorful cards to claim zones and score points. The more claimed zones in a row, the more points. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

On Your Mark!: The Art of Sketching and Guessing Card Game

On your mark, get set, draw! Whether you’re great at drawing or not, you’ll sketch your way to laughter in this creative party game! Start by sketching a secret word or phrase on your canvas card. The twist is that your card already has a mark on it that must be incorporated into your drawing. Score points by guessing other players’ secret words. The player with the most correct guesses wins. It’s hours of fun and might even be your 15 minutes of fame.

Card game includes: 150 TITLE Cards, 150 CANVAS Cards, 8 dry erase markers, 8 card stands, 8 score sheets, 2 erasers and an instruction sheet.
 For ages 10+.
 For 2-8 players.
 Game lasts approximately 30 minutes.
 9.5" W x 2.75" H x 4.5" D

OVERVIEW
The GUVNOR is a gangster themed card trading game. Players trade crime cards simultaneously in order to gain RESPECT from the other players. The first player to win 30 RESPECT points wins the game.

GAMEPLAY
Players are dealt nine random CRIME cards at the start of the game and seven REPECT points. The dealer starts the trading by shouting 'LET'S DO BUSINESS' after which all players may trade cards face down across the table. The first player to collect nine identical CRIME cards shouts 'AVE SOME OF THAT!' to win the round. The winner of the round becomes The GUVNOR and receives a win bonus (PROFIT). All the other players then pay The GUVNOR one RESPECT point from their pile. Any players caught RED HANDED (i.e. they have six or more identical CRIME cards in their hand) pay a penalty. The GUVNOR then takes a DECREE card from a wild deck - it may effect them directly or it may be used to hindered/help another player. The CRIME cards are then returned, shuffled and the next round begins.
